name: Association of Nordic Engineers
goal:
The Association of Nordic Engineers, ANE promotes the interests of Nordic engineers in international affairs, reinforces the Nordic cross-organisational cooperation and raises awareness of the Nordic engineers’ work life balance model.
Together we make the crucial role of engineers in society much more visible. We find common solutions to current global challenges and strengthen our influence on cross border decisions at EU level, which impact our members’ lives and careers. We coordinate our positions and make ourselves heard speaking with one voice in international organisations and across the Nordic region.
ANE represents 360.000 members.
Objectives:
1) Influencing relevant policy and decision-making processes at global, EU and national level;
2) Promoting the role and the professions of engineers in the society;
3) Supporting sustainable education policies;
4) Enabling sufficient supply and demand for skilled engineers in future;
5) Advocating for engineers’ mobility at global level, in EU and Nordic countries;
6) Safeguarding and improving working conditions for engineers.
interests: Climate Action, Education, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Environment, Information Society, Research and Technology
euInitiatives:
1) Digital agenda and Artificial Intelligence;
2) EU new skills agenda, including STEM,
3) EU industry strategy;
4) Whistlblower protection;
5) Work-life balance;
6) New forms of work;
7) EU energy policy
